headline: WestCX Launches Engage: Real-Time AI That Speaks, Listens, and Learns Across Every Patient Interaction
summary: New Engage, LinguaAI, and Journey Insights solutions bring multilingual, measurable, and human-like communication to healthcare organizationsOMAHA, Neb., Nov. 04, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- WestCX, part of West Technology Group, today announced the launch of Engage, the next generation of its AI-native engagement platform. The launch unites Engage, LinguaAI, and Journey Insights into a single ecosystem that enables healthcare organizations to deliver intelligent, multilingual, and measurable patie

headline: Apollo Reports Third Quarter 2025 Results
summary: NEW YORK, Nov. 04, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Apollo Global Management, Inc. (NYSE: APO) (together with its consolidated subsidiaries, “Apollo”) today reported results for the third quarter ended September 30, 2025. headline: Ørsted sells 50% stake in Hornsea 3 offshore wind farm for $6.5bn
summary: Hornsea 3 is being constructed within Ørsted’s Hornsea zone, alongside the Hornsea 1 and 2 projects.

raw.headline: Ørsted sells 50% stake in Hornsea 3 offshore wind farm for $6.5bn

headline: McDonald’s Earnings, Tariff Update, Musk Pay Vote: What to Watch This Week
summary: All eyes are on the government shutdown, which is nearing the longest on record. Meanwhile, investors will dig into earnings from McDonald’s, AMD and others. On Thursday, Tesla is due to publish the outcome of its shareholder vote on CEO Elon Musk’s pay package.

raw.headline: McDonald’s Earnings, Tariff Update, Musk Pay Vote: What to Watch This Week

headline: Ørsted Sells 50% of Hornsea 3 Offshore Wind Project to Apollo for $5.6 Billion
summary: Ørsted has agreed to sell a 50% stake in its 2.9 GW Hornsea 3 offshore wind farm to Apollo-managed funds for approximately DKK 39 billion ($5.6 billion).

raw.headline: Ørsted Sells 50% of Hornsea 3 Offshore Wind Project to Apollo for $5.6 Billion
raw.summary: Ørsted has agreed to sell a 50% stake in its 2.9 GW Hornsea 3 offshore wind farm to Apollo-managed funds for approximately DKK 39 billion ($5.6 billion).
